episodeTitle: The Witch of Cocoyasi Village, Arlong's Female Officer
episodeTitleJapanese: ココヤシ村の魔女！アーロンの女幹部
episodeTitleRomanized: Kokoyashi mura no majo! Āron no jokanbu
description: Luffy, Sanji, and Yosaku capture Momoo, the Arlong Pirates' sea beast, forcing it to carry them to Arlong Park. Meanwhile, Arlong arrives at Cocoyasi Village to punish Genzo for possessing a weapon. Usopp intervenes to save the village from destruction. Zoro tests Nami's loyalty by jumping into a pool, and Nami saves him but orders his imprisonment. At Bell-mère's grave, Nami reaffirms her determination to raise 100 million bellies to buy back her village from Arlong.

events.title: Momoo's Debut
events.description: Momoo, a giant sea cow creature from the Grand Line, emerges from the ocean and attacks Luffy, Sanji, and Yosaku's ship, attracted by the smell of their food. The massive sea beast serves as one of Arlong's pets.
events.significance: First appearance of Arlong's sea beast. Introduces the concept of sea monsters serving pirate crews as weapons and transportation.

events.title: Luffy and Sanji Defeat Momoo
events.description: Luffy and Sanji quickly overpower Momoo with their combined strength. Luffy uses his stretching abilities while Sanji delivers powerful kicks, forcing the sea beast into submission despite its massive size and intimidating appearance.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy and Sanji's growing combat prowess. Shows they can easily defeat creatures that would terrify most East Blue pirates.

events.title: Momoo Becomes Transportation
events.description: After defeating Momoo, Luffy forces the giant sea cow to carry their ship toward Arlong Park. The fearful creature complies, providing the crew with fast and convenient transportation across the ocean.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's practical thinking in combat situations. The capture of Arlong's sea beast also represents a small victory against the Arlong Pirates before the main confrontation.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy commanding Momoo to carry them to their destination

events.title: Cocoyasi Village Debut
events.description: Cocoyasi Village is introduced as Nami's home village in the Conomi Islands. The village features palm trees, mikan groves, rice fields, and a peaceful seaside setting, but lives under the oppressive rule of the Arlong Pirates.
events.significance: Introduction of Nami's home and the central location for understanding her backstory. Establishes the setting for the emotional core of the Arlong Park Arc.

events.title: Nojiko Reveals Nami's Past
events.description: Nojiko, introduced as Nami's adoptive sister, explains to Usopp that both she and Nami were orphans raised by Bell-mère in Cocoyasi Village. She describes Nami as 'like some sort of witch' for preventing villagers from fighting Arlong and joining his crew instead.
events.significance: First major revelation about Nami's family and past. Establishes the foundation for understanding Nami's motivations and her relationship with Arlong.

quotes.text: Nami is like some sort of witch, blocking our rescue attempts and joining Arlong's gang.
quotes.speaker: Nojiko
quotes.context: Nojiko explaining Nami's behavior to Usopp

events.title: Genzo's Debut
events.description: Genzo, the sheriff of Cocoyasi Village and father figure to Nami, makes his first appearance. He is confronted by Arlong for possessing a weapon, which Arlong considers an act of rebellion against his rule.
events.significance: Introduction of Nami's adoptive father figure and protector of the village. His confrontation with Arlong demonstrates the oppressive nature of Arlong's regime.

events.title: Arlong's Tribute System Explained
events.description: Arlong explains his tyrannical system of control: he has 20 villages and towns under his rule, forcing all citizens to pay monthly tributes (100,000 bellies per adult, 50,000 per child) in exchange for their lives. Failure to pay results in the destruction of entire communities, as happened to Gosa Village.
events.significance: Reveals the full extent of Arlong's oppression and establishes him as a ruthless tyrant. Explains why the villages are so terrified and unable to resist.

quotes.text: I've got 20 villages and towns under my control. Rebels are a pain in the butt.
quotes.speaker: Arlong
quotes.context: Arlong explaining his system of control to the villagers

events.title: Arlong Threatens to Execute Genzo
events.description: Arlong decides to execute Genzo for the crime of possessing a weapon, deeming it an act of rebellion. This public execution is meant to serve as a warning to other villages under his control about the consequences of defiance.
events.significance: Escalates the conflict and demonstrates Arlong's brutality. Sets up Usopp's heroic intervention and shows the stakes for those living under Arlong's rule.

events.title: Usopp's Heroic Intervention
events.description: Usopp, identifying himself as 'the brave warrior of the sea, Captain Usopp,' intervenes by shooting Arlong with his slingshot from atop a house. This unexpected act of defiance stops the execution and saves Genzo's life.
events.significance: Major character moment for Usopp, showing his bravery despite his usual cowardice. Prevents Genzo's death and triggers Arlong's rage against the village.

quotes.text: I am the brave warrior of the sea, Captain Usopp!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp introducing himself while intervening to save Genzo

events.title: Arlong's Destructive Rage
events.description: Enraged by Usopp's attack, Arlong lifts the house Usopp is standing on off its foundation and slams it into a neighboring house, demonstrating his overwhelming physical strength and violent temperament when challenged.
events.significance: Showcases Arlong's superhuman strength and the immediate danger he poses to the village. Creates tension as Cocoyasi Village itself is threatened with destruction.

events.title: Arlong's Crew Restrains Him
events.description: Fearing the loss of a profitable tributary village, Arlong's crew members physically restrain him to prevent him from destroying Cocoyasi Village in his rage. This demonstrates that even Arlong's own crew recognizes the value of keeping the villages intact for tribute collection.
events.significance: Shows the purely financial motivation behind Arlong's 'rule' and reveals internal dynamics of the Arlong Pirates. The village is saved not by mercy but by greed.

events.title: Nako's Debut
events.description: Dr. Nako, the elderly village doctor of Cocoyasi Village, makes his first appearance. He is recognizable by his wrinkled face, grey hair and goatee, bandanna with a red cross, and sunglasses.
events.significance: Introduces the village's medical professional. Nako later treats injured crew members and plays a role in Nami's childhood backstory with Bell-mère.

events.title: Pisaro's Debut
events.description: Pisaro, the musician of the Arlong Pirates and an ocean sunfish fish-man, makes his first appearance. He is recognizable by his large lips, light blue skin, curly brown hair, and purple star-patterned shirt, usually carrying maracas.
events.significance: Introduction of another member of the Arlong Pirates crew, expanding the roster of antagonists for the arc.

events.title: Zoro Tests Nami's Loyalty
events.description: At Arlong Park, Zoro deliberately jumps into the pool to test whether Nami truly has become a heartless member of Arlong's crew. This shocking act forces Nami to reveal her true feelings.
events.significance: Pivotal moment that tests Nami's character. Zoro's willingness to risk his life demonstrates his trust in his instincts about Nami's true nature.

events.title: Nami Saves Zoro
events.description: Despite her outward allegiance to Arlong, Nami immediately dives into the pool and saves Zoro from drowning. However, to maintain her cover, she then orders the pirates to imprison him, revealing the internal conflict she faces.
events.significance: Proves that Nami hasn't truly abandoned her humanity or her crewmates. This moment reveals her true loyalties while showing the difficult position she's in.

events.title: Zoro's Imprisonment
events.description: Following Nami's orders, the Arlong Pirates imprison Zoro at Arlong Park. Despite being captured, Zoro now understands that Nami still cares about the crew and is working under duress.
events.significance: Sets up the rescue subplot and confirms Zoro's understanding of Nami's true situation. His capture also raises the stakes for the crew's assault on Arlong Park.

events.title: Bell-mère's Grave Introduced
events.description: Nami visits a grave marker on a cliff overlooking the ocean - the resting place of Bell-mère, her adoptive mother. The peaceful clifftop location serves as a place where Nami can reflect on her past and renew her determination.
events.significance: Introduction of Bell-mère's grave as a symbolic location representing Nami's motivation and connection to her past. This location becomes important for character moments throughout the arc.

events.title: Nami's 100 Million Beli Deal Revealed
events.description: At Bell-mère's grave, Nami reaffirms her determination to raise 100 million bellies to buy back Cocoyasi Village from Arlong. This reveals the deal she made with Arlong: if she can gather this massive sum, Arlong will return the village to its people.
events.significance: Central revelation that explains Nami's entire motivation and actions. Establishes the seemingly impossible goal that has driven Nami to become Arlong's cartographer and thief.

quotes.text: I will raise one hundred million bellies and buy back our village from Arlong.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami at Bell-mère's grave, reaffirming her determination

quotes.text: I will raise one hundred million bellies and buy back our village from Arlong.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: At Bell-mère's grave, declaring her determination

quotes.text: I am the brave warrior of the sea, Captain Usopp!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Intervening to save Genzo from execution

quotes.text: I've got 20 villages and towns under my control. Rebels are a pain in the butt.
quotes.speaker: Arlong
quotes.context: Explaining his tyrannical system to the villagers

quotes.text: Nami is like some sort of witch, blocking our rescue attempts and joining Arlong's gang.
quotes.speaker: Nojiko
Luffy
quotes.context: Commanding Momoo to carry them to Arlong Park

themes.description: Nami's actions throughout the episode reveal a character making tremendous sacrifices for others while being misunderstood. She saves Zoro despite her facade of loyalty to Arlong, and works tirelessly toward an impossible goal to save her village.
themes.symbolism: Nami being called a 'witch' symbolizes how noble sacrifices can be misinterpreted when others don't understand the full context. Her dual actions (saving then imprisoning Zoro) represent the painful compromises she must make.

themes.description: Arlong's tribute system represents systematic oppression through economic exploitation. By forcing villages to pay for their own lives, he creates a form of control that doesn't require constant military presence.
themes.symbolism: The 100,000/50,000 beli tribute system symbolizes how tyranny can operate through financial pressure rather than just violence. Gosa Village's destruction shows the consequences of resistance.
culturalReferences: Historical examples of tribute systems and protection rackets

themes.description: Both Usopp and Zoro demonstrate courage by taking dangerous actions - Usopp attacking Arlong to save Genzo, and Zoro testing Nami's loyalty by risking drowning.
themes.symbolism: Usopp's slingshot against a superhuman fish-man represents the power of moral courage over physical strength. Zoro's leap into the pool symbolizes faith in understanding another person's true character.

themes.description: Nami's quest to raise 100 million bellies represents the crushing weight of an nearly impossible task undertaken for the sake of loved ones.
themes.symbolism: Bell-mère's clifftop grave overlooking the ocean represents both the freedom Nami seeks and the responsibility she bears to honor her mother's sacrifice.

characterSpotlights.development: The episode reveals Nami's true motivations and the painful position she's in. Her actions of saving Zoro then imprisoning him demonstrate her internal conflict between protecting her crewmates and maintaining the facade needed to achieve her goal.
keyActions: Saves Zoro from drowning despite her allegiance to Arlong
Orders Zoro's imprisonment to maintain her cover
Visits Bell-mère's grave
Reaffirms her determination to raise 100 million bellies
quotes: I will raise one hundred million bellies and buy back our village from Arlong.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp overcomes his usual cowardice to save Genzo's life, demonstrating that his bravery is real when others are in danger, despite his tendency to exaggerate and run from fights.
keyActions: Learns about Nami's past from Nojiko
Witnesses Arlong's cruelty firsthand
Attacks Arlong to save Genzo from execution
Survives Arlong's destructive rage
quotes: I am the brave warrior of the sea, Captain Usopp!

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro demonstrates his understanding of human nature by testing Nami's loyalty in a dramatic way. His willingness to risk his life shows his faith in his judgment of her character.
keyActions: Notices Nami's conflicted reactions at Arlong Park
Jumps into the pool to test Nami's loyalty
Allows himself to be captured after confirming his suspicions

characterSpotlights.development: Arlong's tyrannical nature and systematic oppression are fully revealed. His tribute system and willingness to execute people for minor infractions establish him as a ruthless dictator.
keyActions: Confronts Genzo for possessing a weapon
Explains his tribute system controlling 20 villages
Attempts to execute Genzo as a warning to others
Nearly destroys Cocoyasi Village in rage
Observes Nami's conflicted behavior with Zoro
quotes: I've got 20 villages and towns under my control. Rebels are a pain in the butt.

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as the village sheriff and Nami's father figure, Genzo's confrontation with Arlong shows his protective nature and the danger all villagers face under Arlong's rule.
keyActions: Confronted by Arlong for having a weapon
Faces execution for defying Arlong's rules
Saved by Usopp's intervention

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy continues his journey toward Arlong Park with single-minded determination, easily defeating obstacles in his path.
keyActions: Defeats Momoo with Sanji
Forces Momoo to carry them to Arlong Park

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands the confrontation between Usopp and Arlong with additional dialogue and action sequences showing the house being lifted and thrown.
The battle with Momoo is given more screen time in the anime with additional comedic moments and action sequences.

trivia.fact: This episode achieved a 13.1% television rating when it originally aired in Japan on July 19, 2000, ranking #2 for that week.
Episode 32 covers portions of manga Chapters 70-73, showing the anime's pacing of approximately 2-3 chapters per episode during the Arlong Park Arc.
Genzo's character design includes a pinwheel in his cap, which he wore to comfort infant Nami. This pinwheel later becomes incorporated into Nami's iconic tattoo design.
Momoo is the first Sea Beast shown in the One Piece anime, introducing the concept of giant sea creatures from the Grand Line that can serve pirate crews.
The 4Kids English dub gave this episode the alternate title 'The Thief With a Heart of Gold' as part of their attempt to make the series more child-friendly.
This episode was remastered and re-aired on November 17, 2012 as part of the 'Episode of Nami' special compilation covering the Arlong Park Arc.
